metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3170 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: An out-of-bounds access issue was found in the Linux kernel sound subsystem. It could occur when the 'id->name' provided by the user did not end with '\0'. A privileged local user could pass a specially crafted name through ioctl() interface and crash the system or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

notes.Note: alexmurray> Only affects kernel versions >= 6.0-rc1 and < 6.0-rc4

criterions.comment: linux-lowlatency: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
